item.title: Meter
item.description: Definition1 The distance that light travels in $\dfrac{1}{299\ 792\ 458}$ seconds in a vacuum is defined as $1$ meters, and it is denoted by $\text{m}$. Explanation Conversely, the speed of light $c$ is $299\ 792\ 458$ meters per second. This is an exact figure, not an approximation. $$ c = 299\ 792\ 458\ \text{m/s} $$ It is the most popular unit of length and one of the SI base units.
